org.apache.felix.ipojo.handlers.dependency

Class DependencyConfigurationChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.felix.ipojo.handlers.dependency.DependencyConfigurationChecker

  • public class DependencyConfigurationChecker
extends Object
    Utility class checking the configuration of a dependency.

      Checks that the `from` attribute is used consistently: Rule 1 : it cannot be used on aggregate dependency Rule 2 : it cannot be used in combination with the `comparator` attribute Rule 3 : it cannot be used in combination with the `dynamic-priority` binding policy

    • Method Detail

      • ensure

        public static void ensure(Dependency dependency,
                          Element metadata,
                          PojoMetadata manipulation)
                   throws ConfigurationException
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException

      • disableProxyForInconsistentTypes

        private static void disableProxyForInconsistentTypes(Dependency dependency)
                                              throws ConfigurationException
        Disables the proxy settings for types that does not support it: Vector, Array, and non interface specification. If the dependency is disabled, check that we are no constructor injection.
        Parameters:
        dependency - the dependency
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException

      • ensureThatCallbacksAreCoherent

        private static void ensureThatCallbacksAreCoherent(Dependency dependency,
                                                   PojoMetadata manipulation)
                                            throws ConfigurationException
        Checks that the dependency callbacks are consistent:
        • have a supported 'type'
        • have a supported signature
        If the method is not in the component class, a message is logged, as this verification cannot be used. If the method is found in the manipulation metadata, the callback parameters are set.
        Parameters:
        dependency - the dependency
        manipulation - the manipulation
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - if the methods do not obey to the previously mentioned rules.

      • ensureThatTheConstructorParameterIsCoherent

        private static void ensureThatTheConstructorParameterIsCoherent(Dependency dependency,
                                                                PojoMetadata manipulation)
                                                         throws ConfigurationException
        Checks whether the constructor parameter injection is suitable. this check verified that the constructor has enough parameter.
        Parameters:
        dependency - the dependency
        manipulation - the manipulation metadata
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - if the constructor is not suitable

      • ensureThatTheFieldIsInComponentClass

        private static void ensureThatTheFieldIsInComponentClass(Dependency dependency,
                                                         PojoMetadata manipulation)
                                                  throws ConfigurationException
        Checks that the field used to inject the dependency is in the component class. If the dependency has no field, this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        dependency - the dependency
        manipulation - the manipulation metadata
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - if the field used to inject the given dependency is not in the component class.

      • deduceAggregationFromTheInjectionPoints

        private static void deduceAggregationFromTheInjectionPoints(Dependency dependency,
                                                            PojoMetadata manipulation)
                                                     throws ConfigurationException
        Determines if the dependency is aggregate from the field or constructor parameter used to inject the dependency. If the dependency just uses methods, this method does nothing. This method also check that dependencies set to aggregate have a valid injection type.
        Parameters:
        dependency - the dependency
        manipulation - the manipulation metadata
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - if the type of the field or constructor parameter used to inject the dependency is not suitable for aggregate dependencies.

      • ensureThatAtLeastOneInjectionIsSpecified

        private static void ensureThatAtLeastOneInjectionIsSpecified(Dependency dependency)
                                                      throws ConfigurationException
        Checks that the dependency has at least one injection point.
        Parameters:
        dependency - the dependency
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - if the dependency has no injection point

      • checkTheConsistencyOfTheFromAttribute

        private static void checkTheConsistencyOfTheFromAttribute(Dependency dependency,
                                                          Element metadata)
                                                   throws ConfigurationException
        Checks that the `from` attribute is used consistently:
        • Rule 1 : it cannot be used on aggregate dependency
        • Rule 2 : it cannot be used in combination with the `comparator` attribute
        • Rule 3 : it cannot be used in combination with the `dynamic-priority` binding policy
        Parameters:
        dependency - the dependency
        metadata - the dependency metadata
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - if the `from` attribute is used inconsistently.

      • checkTheServiceUnavailableAction

        private static void checkTheServiceUnavailableAction(Dependency dependency,
                                                     Element metadata)
                                              throws ConfigurationException
        Checks that service unavailable actions are consistent.
        • Rule 1: Nullable, Exception, Default-Implementation... can only be used for scalar optional dependency
        • Rule 2: Only one can be used
        • Rule 3: Timeout can only be used on optional dependency
        Parameters:
        dependency - the dependency
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - if the dependency used inconsistent attributes

      • deduceTheServiceSpecification

        private static void deduceTheServiceSpecification(Dependency dependency,
                                                  PojoMetadata manipulation)
                                           throws ConfigurationException
        Tries to determine the service specification to inject in the dependency. If the specification is already checked by the dependency, just checks the consistency.
        Parameters:
        dependency - the dependency
        manipulation - the manipulation metadata
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - if the specification cannot be deduced, or when the set specification is not consistent.

      • extractSpecificationFromMethods

        private static String extractSpecificationFromMethods(Dependency dependency,
                                                      DependencyCallback[] callbacks,
                                                      PojoMetadata manipulation)
                                               throws ConfigurationException
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException

      • extractSpecificationFromConstructor

        private static String extractSpecificationFromConstructor(int index,
                                                          PojoMetadata manipulation)

      • extractSpecificationFromField

        private static String extractSpecificationFromField(String field,
                                                    PojoMetadata manipulation)
        Extracts the service specification from the field. When this method is called, we know that the field is containing in the component class.
        Parameters:
        field - the field
        manipulation - the manipulation metadata
        Returns:
        the service specification, or null if is cannot be extracted.

      • setSpecification

        private static void setSpecification(Dependency dep,
                                     String className)
                              throws ConfigurationException
        Sets the dependency specification. If the dependency has already a specification set, throw an error if the current specification and the given one are not equal.
        Parameters:
        dep - the dependency
        className - the service specification
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - if the given specification is not loadable or if the dependency has already a specification set that is not the given one.
